meanings.definition: To disturb the composure of; unsettle
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site was discomposing the students during the exam.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news about the test results discomposing her calm demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept discomposing the peaceful atmosphere by barking at the birds.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds discomposing the once clear sky, foretelling a storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house was discomposing, making everyone feel uneasy.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel self-conscious or embarrassed
meanings.sent1: Being called out for his mistake in front of the whole class discomposing him greatly.
meanings.sent2: She felt discomposingly awkward when she realized she had been talking to the wrong person.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected spotlight on him discomposing him into a fit of nervous laughter.
meanings.sent4: The bright stage lights discomposing her like a deer caught in headlights.
meanings.sent5: His mismatched outfit was discomposing, drawing unwanted attention to him.

meanings.definition: To put out of order; disarrange
meanings.sent1: The mischievous toddler kept discomposing the neatly stacked books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind discomposing the carefully arranged picnic setup.
meanings.sent3: The playful kittens discomposing the perfectly made bed every morning.
meanings.sent4: The sudden power outage discomposing the entire schedule of the day.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous elf was discomposing the holiday decorations in the house.
